sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: NGOs and residents of Kharkiv in Ukraine march against potential escalation with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They do not care about its own people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The US slams North Korea over latest missile launch at UN Security meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iceland decides to end whaling by 2024, citing that the practice is unsustainable from a social, economic and ecological perspective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Ukraine, residents and NGOs of Kharkiv in the northeast marched on Saturday against potential escalation with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The gathering comes amid heightened tensions between the two states over thousands of Russian troops close to Ukraine's borders, prompting fears of an invasion. The position of Russian troops has made some Ukrainian civilians want to learn to defend their homes. Hundreds have now joined the army's reserves, and Chernobyl is being used as a training ground for Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The purpose of these exercises was to work out a scenario, the seizure of the premises and its liberation by the National Guard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's what you just saw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Another purpose is to practice sniper couple work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You've seen how it works. All these scenarios were taken and summarized from the cases that have occurred since 2014 during the Russian-Ukrainian war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia's Ministry of Defense has said that it is deploying military jets to Belarus ahead of joint drills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian army is also continuing to deploy military vehicles close to Ukrainian borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And American troops and equipment are arriving in Poland after President Joe Biden ordered the deployment of 1,700 soldiers there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The United States has denounced the latest ballistic missile launch by North Korea at a UN security meeting held on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Pyongyang performed its biggest missile test in more than four years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The US's stance was echoed by allied nations such as Britain, France, Brazil and Ireland who condemned the launch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We care about the humanitarian situation on the ground there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have worked to provide humanitarian support in every way possible, but to spend millions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: of dollars on military tests when your people are starving, I think indicates that this country does not care about its own people.â€³ Meanwhile, China has called upon Washington for a more adaptable approach to deterring missile launches. If they do want to see some new breakthrough, they should show more sincerity and the flexibility. It was no huge surprise Kim Jong-un's regime ignored warnings and condemnation from Western nations, with hints of restarting long-range and nuclear testing being made since the start of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In northwestern Afghanistan, young girls being sold into marriage to grown men is the norm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For desperate families, it is the only way to escape extreme poverty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We don't have anything to eat, then we sell them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Father Abdul Ghani had his deal cancelled because of his daughter's injured leg. She was sold before getting injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now he is not giving me anything and I have 100,000 Afghanis in debt to pay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Taliban denies the country is in a humanitarian crisis, saying that the country is safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People are coming to Afghanistan to help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Since the Islamic Emirate has taken over the country, no one has had any security issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Around 90% of the Afghanistan population are dependent on aid from the UN and other humanitarian organisations, with 3 million people being displaced in their own country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rescuers inched closer on Friday to reaching a five-year-old boy trapped for three days in a well in Morocco in an operation hampered by ground stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Crowds have gathered extensively at the site, praying for the child's safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The boy, identified as Rayan, fell into a 32-meter-deep well, that's 105 feet, located outside his home village of Igran in Morocco's northern Chefchaouen province on Tuesday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As the rescue continues, threats of a landslide loom due to stress to the ground caused by digging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Search crews first used five bulldozers to dig vertically downward to a depth of more than 31 metres, according to Morocco's official MAP news agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Then on Friday, they started excavating a horizontal tunnel to reach the trapped boy, MAP said, adding that experts in topographical engineering were called upon to help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Turkey's Justice Minister said a fire broke out at an Istanbul prison on Friday, leaving

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 20 inmates and one prison warden hospitalised for smoke inhalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There was no information on the cause of the blaze.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Prison inmates in Turkey have set mattresses and other bedding alight in the past to protest detention conditions. Justice Minister Bekir Bozdag said on Twitter that none of those hospitalized were in serious condition. A small plane carrying tourists crashed near the ancient

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nazca Lines in Peru, killing seven people, according to the transport ministry. Rescue workers arrived at the scene only to find what remained. Local police added that the deceased included three Dutch tourists, two Chilean tourists and two Peruvian members of the crew.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Madagascar is preparing for the arrival of Cyclone Batsaray

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: with residents touching up their roofs to mitigate damages to their houses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Cyclone Batsarai is expected to make landfall on Madagascar's east coast on Saturday morning, after passing through Mauritius.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Austria, the death toll following a series of avalanches in the Tyrolean-Swiss border has risen to eight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Swiss and Austrian emergency helicopter services could only fly to the scene due to the heavy snowfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Avalanches have been prevalent in the region, with 50 avalanches occurring in Tyrol today alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in the region, with 50 avalanches occurring in Tyrol today alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The race for lithium in Portugal has reached a pinnacle moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While local residents are against the mining of the precious metal, citing huge environmental ramifications including water contamination, the country's environment ministry has given the green light to mining the white gold in six different areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, the municipality of Pinil will file an injunction to stop exploration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Locals say plans for a mine in Fundau will interfere with the main irrigation system in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The mayor of Fundau says it will never be possible, I would say for the municipalities,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: but also for the administration and even for the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That mine will take place in what is one of the main assets of agricultural production,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: where there is such large investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Besides, within this same area there are urban centres." But according to Savannah Resources, a London-based mining company, Portugal has 60,000 tonnes of known lithium reserves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, the mining of this essential metal, which has been used for decades in the electronics and pharmaceutical industries, may also contribute to deforestation and air pollution, which will have a negative impact on many local populations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This local resident says, we have heard about the dangers and the problems it will create

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: for the environment and also for people, so it's worrying to know that they will come to exploit it here in our territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Despite concerns of irreversible environmental damage, licenses to search for lithium in other parts of the country have already been granted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iceland plans to end whaling from 2024 due to a fall in demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The return of whaling in Japan in 2019 has left a small market for Icelandic whalers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the past three years Iceland's whalers have barely taken their boats out into the North Atlantic, being a costly endeavour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the experts, whaling is an activity that has to be rigorously controlled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Moreover, it might not be sustainable for other reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So our advice for whales, just as in every other marine stock that is being harvested, is to set maximum limits rather than recommend harvesting or not of a specific resource.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Even if the whaling is sustainable from a biological point of view, it might not be socially or economically sustainable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's again outside our field.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Rather than ending up as steaks on a plate, whales have in recent years become the stars of a flourishing ecotourism scene. More than 360,000 whale watchers flocked to Iceland in 2019.
